instructions:
Wash, halve and remove seeds and white membrane from green peppers leaving a clean shell. Place in
boiling salted water and boil 3 minutes or until tender but still
firm. Drain and set aside. Place ground beef, chopped pepper and onion and about 1/2 tbsp drippings in a
frying pan. Break up and brown ground beef *(about 5 minutes)*. Remove excess grease. Stir in remaining
ingredients and simmer for about 5 minutes. Fill pepper halves mounding slightly. *(At this point they may
be wrapped in foil and frozen.)* Place stuffed peppers in a shallow baking dish,
sprinkle with cracker crumbs and top with a dab of butter. Add 1 tbsp of water to baking dish and bake in a
375-degree oven for 25 to 30 minutes or until browned. Serves 4. 
*(Rev. 8/16/93)*.

If frozen, thaw, add 1 tbsp water, heat in 400 F oven wrapped in foil for 20 minutes. Unwrap, sprinkle
with cracker crumbs, add a dab of butter and continue baking in a 400 F oven for an additional 22 to 25
minutes.
ingredients: 1/2 envelope G Washington Brown seasoning mix
name: Stuffed Peppers
creator: Mary & Jim Decker
